I mean I can only imagine the stress level on the stage in front of hundreds of people, she also once said that she hates speeches because she gets really stressed out. I truly believe that the fault is in Amber and Johny, but sadly it got out of control and things got messy.

comment: If anyone s having suicidal thoughts, please.. please reconsider. You may feel you 're not loved and not good enough, but know that it's because you're surrounded by the wrong people. You are strong enough to endure for the sake of having a better life in the future. It's not easy and it WILL get worse before it gets better. Find friends with the right mindset. They are a minority but they are out there. Even if it's online friends they will be there for you. There is free counseling online that has helped me through. Please never give up looking for help. We cannot afford losing good people like this just because they are surrounded by dicks who never knew better. You are loved by minorities who care arround the globe. We only have eachother ♡ never compare your troubles to others because that will only make things worse. Never judge yourself but try to build this persona inside that encourrages you when you feel like you have no one else to support you. Don't hate but love as hard as it sounds. Never stop loving yourself! You are worthy of every beautiful thing this life has to offer. Live so you can tell your story when you're all healed up. Live for the people who love you and those who don't know you but are still willing to help. Live for yourself first and then good things will slowly happen. Believe in yourself ♡♡♡ i love you

comment:
I do think this woman is the biggest waste of air BUT... The phone rang by accident. Was it her friend's phone or did she just do a very good celebrity job of diffusing an embarrassing situation like that? I felt that she did a good job saying "Oh I so needed that", as in, "this topic is so serious, that an accident like that makes it bearable". I'm not sure if that was sincere, but then again, how many of these speeches are entirely, 100% sincere, ever? She could have made the situation more awkward by listening on the phone ring and act like the person in question did the biggest faux par ever, but she laughed it off. This is not a funeral, at least.

Laughter is the best medicine, they say, and sometimes perfectly normal individuals laugh in the most awkward times, and it has the side dish of making a moment like this bearable. 

I don't like painting people either good or bad, entirely, like there had to be SOMETHING about this girl for someone like Johnny to fall for, right? I don't think she acted inhumane in that, personally, even though I am team Johnny all the way - even in defending his choice in the first place. She can't be all bad if he put up with her crap for so long, there had to be something right or not that bad in her, too, right?

comment: This may be the most insincere thing I've ever seen.  Amber Heard is a narcissist, so she is devoid of empathy...but this is more than just a speech about suicide...Ms. Heard is actually *telling someone's personal story.*  Even a narcissist would know that this is no place for levity.  Once again, Ms. Heard seems to have taken *something* that has left her appearing to be numb, and not  completely in control of herself.  Her laughter bursts out, violently, from just below the surface, and even *she* seems aware that her reaction was wrong...in fact, I find her reaction *shocking.*  She attempts to immediately return to "sensitive girl moved to tears", but is stumbling over her words, and smiling awkwardly at her "friend".
